OUTPUT: ['The Gospel of John is the fourth book of the New Testament in the Bible and provides an account of the life, ministry, death, and resurrection of Jesus Christ.', 'The internal evidence within the text itself provides some clues about its authorship, such as references to the Beloved Disciple and the use of the first person plural "we" in certain passages.', 'This attribution has been supported by many scholars throughout history, including early Church Fathers such as Irenaeus and Tertullian.', 'Some of these alternative theories include:', 'The Gospel was written by an unknown disciple of Jesus, known as the "Beloved Disciple," who is mentioned in the text itself.', 'The Gospel was written by a later Christian author who redacted earlier sources to create a unified narrative.', 'The Gospel was written by John himself, but at a later time than traditionally believed (e.g., during the reign of Emperor Domitian in the 2nd century).']
